heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A –
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – 
Temporary Requirements) (Covid-19 Passenger Locator Form) (Amendment) 
(No. 4) Regulations 2020.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited health act 1947 (section 31a - temporary requirements) (covid-19 passenger locator form) (amendment) (no 4) regulation 2020

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 2. Regulation 2 of the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary
text_raw:
2. Regulation 2 of the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary 
Requirements) (Covid-19 Passenger Locator Form) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 
181 of 2020) is amended by the substitution of “the 17th day of August 2020” 
for “the 10th day of August 2020”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

7 August, 2020. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 11th August, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [294] 3

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations, made under section 31A of the Health Act 1947 (inserted 
by section 10 of the Health (Preservation and Protection and other Emergency 
Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020), provide for the imposition of a 
requirement that international passengers (including Irish citizens) arriving in 
the State at a port or airport from a place outside the State complete a COVID19 Passenger Locator Form for the purposes of recording and verifying 
information regarding their contact details and place of residence for a period 
of up to 14 days following arrival. The Regulations were initially in effect 
between the dates 28th May and 18th June, since extended to 10th August. The 
Instrument provides for the amendment of the Regulation through the 
substitution of “the 17th day of August 2020” for “the 10th day of August 
2020”.
